dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1910 IH: Put a Woman on the Twenty Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Guti√©rrez introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of the Treasury to convene a panel to solicit recommendations for and select a portrait of a woman to be used in a redesign of the $20 Federal Reserve note.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Put a Woman on the Twenty Act of 2015.

section.header: Selection of a portrait for the $20 Federal Reserve note
section.text: The Secretary of the Treasury shall make such arrangements as are necessary to convene a panel of United States citizens to solicit recommendations from the public for a portrait of a woman to be used in a redesign of the $20 Federal Reserve note. The panel shall submit a recommendation to the Secretary of the Treasury on a date determined by the Secretary.
